page.title: 12A typical day at our school
page.content: School begins at nine o'clock but most people get there about ten minutes early. Only four people usually walk to school. The other twentyfour people have to be brought by cars. As soon as we get to school we come straight in and look to see what we have to do first. (Our teacher writes it down on a pad so we can get started straight away.) We stop for Assembly at about ten o'clock. The little class come to join us. After that we go out into the yard to play. The milkman who is Jeremy's dad usually brings the milk at playtime. Sometimes we work outside doing estimating and measuring or drawing. We eat our dinner in the class room. We put tablecloths over the desks. On Tuesday and Thursdays we do P.E. outside. We usually end the day with a story or quiet reading.
